      • isRoadAtLocation

        public boolean isRoadAtLocation(EdgeLocation e)
        Determines whether a road already exists at a chosen location.
        Parameters:
        e - EdgeLocation
        Returns:
        boolean
        Pre Conditions:;
        none
        Post Conditions:
        returns true if a road already exists at the specified location, false otherwise

      • isCityOrSettlementAtLocation

        Determines whether a city or settlement already exists at a chosen location.
        Parameters:
        loc - VertexLocation
        Returns:
        boolean
        Pre Conditions:;
        none
        Post Conditions:
        returns true if a road already exists at the specified location, false otherwise

      • hasAdjacentCityOrSettlement

        public boolean hasAdjacentCityOrSettlement(VertexLocation loc)
        Determines if a particular location is adjacent to a city or a settlement.
        Parameters:
        loc - VertexLocation
        Returns:
        boolean
        Pre Conditions:;
        loc is a valid map location., loc is on land.
        Post Conditions:
        returns true if any adjacent vertex holds a city or a settlement, false otherwise.

      • isVertexLocationOnLand

        public boolean isVertexLocationOnLand(VertexLocation loc)
        Determines if a given VertexLocation is on land. "On land" means at least one adjacent hex is land.
        Parameters:
        loc - VertexLocation
        Returns:
        boolean
        Pre Conditions:;
        loc is a valid location.
        Post Conditions:
        returns true if the location is on land, false otherwise.

      • isEdgeOnLand

        public boolean isEdgeOnLand(EdgeLocation location)

      • isValidHex

        public boolean isValidHex(HexLocation hex)
        Determines if a given hex is on the map.
        Parameters:
        hex - the HexLocation in question
        Returns:
        boolean
        Pre Conditions:;
        none
        Post Conditions:
        returns true if the hex is on the map, false otherwise. The following algorithm determines if a hex location is on the map. x >= -r, x <= r if x < 0 y >= -r+x, y <= r if x >= 0 y >= -r, y <= r-x

      • isAdjacentToPlayerRoad

        public boolean isAdjacentToPlayerRoad(int player,

        Checks if a VertexLocation is adjacent to a road owned by the player.
        Parameters:

        loc - VertexLocation
        Returns:
        boolean

      • settlementBelongsToPlayer

        public boolean settlementBelongsToPlayer(int player,
                                VertexLocation loc)
        Checks if a location is a city belonging to a player.
        Parameters:
        player - int
        loc - VertexLocation
        Returns:
        boolean
        Pre Conditions:;
        A player's index and a VertexLocation is passed in.
        Post Conditions:
        Returns true if the location is a city and the city belongs to the player, false otherwise.

      • roadAdjToPlayerRoadSettCity

        public boolean roadAdjToPlayerRoadSettCity(int player,
                                  EdgeLocation location)
        Determines if a road location is adjacent to a road, settlement, or city owned by a player.
        Parameters:
        player - the player in question
        location - the EdgeLocation in question
        Returns:
        boolean
        Pre Conditions:;
        road is a valid road location, road is on land
        Post Conditions:
        player is a valid player index (0-3), returns true if the road is adjacent to another city or settlement owned by the player. It also returns true if the road is adjacent to another road owned by the player AND there is no foreign city or settlement between the road and the player.

      • edgeAdjToPlayerRoad

        public boolean edgeAdjToPlayerRoad(int player,
                          EdgeLocation givenEdgeLoc)

      • getVertexBetweenEdges

        public VertexLocation getVertexBetweenEdges(EdgeLocation loc1,
                                   EdgeLocation loc2)
        Gets the vertex between two adjacent edges. If the edges are not adjacent, returns null.
        Parameters:
        loc1 - the first EdgeLocation
        loc2 - the second EdgeLocation
        Returns:
        a VertexLocation showing the vertex between two edge, or null if the edges are not adjacent.

      • getRoadsAdjacentToRoad

        public java.util.Set<Road> getRoadsAdjacentToRoad(EdgeLocation givenEdgeLoc)
        Gets all the roads on the map that are adjacent to a certain EdgeLocation. Ignores ownership. Returns a Set of size 0, 1, 2, 3, or 4.
        Parameters:
        givenEdgeLoc - the EdgeLocation in question.
        Returns:
        Set

      • edgeHasFreeVertex

        public boolean edgeHasFreeVertex(EdgeLocation location)
        Checks that an EdgeLocation, when placed, will have an available space for a settlement next to it. Useful for FIRSTROUND and SECONDROUND when players are putting roads before settlements.
        Parameters:
        location - the EdgeLocation in question
        Returns:
        boolean
